org.jscsi.parser
Class BasicHeaderSegment

java.lang.Object
  org.jscsi.parser.BasicHeaderSegment

public final class BasicHeaderSegment
extends java.lang.Object

BasicHeaderSegment

This class encapsulate a Basic Header Segment (BHS), which is defined in the iSCSI Protocol (RFC3720). It provides methods for serializing or deserializing such an object. The contained data can be accessed seperately by the getter methods.

The BHS has a fixed size, which is stored in the variable BHS_FIXED_SIZE. And these must the first bytes in a valid iSCSI Protocol Data Unit (PDU). org.jscsi.utils

Author:
Volker Wildi

isFinalFlag

public final boolean isFinalFlag()
When this flag is set it indicates the final (or only) PDU of a sequence. In some kinds of messages (PDU) this methods has the meaning of the TransitFlag.

Returns:
The state of the final flag.

isImmediateFlag

public final boolean isImmediateFlag()
For request PDUs, the immediate flag can be set as an immediate delivery marker.

Returns:
The state of the immediate flag.

getInitiatorTaskTag

public final int getInitiatorTaskTag()
The initiator assigns a Task Tag to each iSCSI task it issues. While a task exists, this tag MUST uniquely identify the task session-wide. SCSI may also use the initiator task tag as part of the SCSI task identifier when the timespan during which an iSCSI initiator task tag must be unique extends over the timespan during which a SCSI task tag must be unique. However, the iSCSI Initiator Task Tag must exist and be unique even for untagged SCSI commands.

Returns:
the initiator task tag.

The length of the Additional Header Segment.
